page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Well served as we are in comparison with many parts of rural Lincolnshire the use of public transport is by no means easy.Heckington is very fortunate in still having a railway station linking it to the main line station at Grantham. Bus services are very limited running only at peak hours making a short distance shopping journey into a full day's excursion.Daily services run into Sleaford but there is only a twice weekly service to Boston on market days(Wednesday and Saturday). A car has become a necessity, however obtaining petrol requires forethought, the village pumps having been closed three years ago.The nearest petrol stations are at East Heckington on the way to Boston or in the town of Sleaford.
